website_summaries.verdict: The U-Turn Orbit Basic turntable manages to keep costs low while streamlining the set-up and offering shoppers a lot of options to customize the color and build. It's currently our favorite sub-$200 turntable and deserves the attention of audiophiles and casual listeners alike.
pros: The precalibrated cartridge cuts the initial setup time down to under five minutes, the Web store has plenty of custom options for colors and upgraded parts, and the turntable has a smooth, clear sound that spans all genres
cons: The manual speed adjustment could get tedious If you often switch between 33 and 45 RPM records

customer_reviews.title: Best turntable I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the U-Turn Orbit plus in blue. This turntable is so easy to set up, use, and the sound reproduction is fantastic. Today I added a small LED strip behind the platter just for fun. I am loving the sound of my old LPs again. I am 67 years old and have been collecting LPs since The Beatles first hit the american shores. The Ortofon cartridge brings out sound I didn't even know were there.
customer_reviews.author: billybochy

customer_reviews.title: Spend somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: The fact that this can play a record does not make up for the piece of rope they claim as a belt. The platter needs a groove and the belt needs a tiny bit of tension so it isn't absurdly frustrating. If you already bought it turn the table on while you fix the belt for the umpteenth time.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K.

customer_reviews.title: Superb Turntable
customer_reviews.text: This is one great turntable. The design is geared towards the vinyl enthusiast. The belt driven platter is designed to eliminate any motor noise whatsoever. It's a thin loop that rides the outside of the platter, duvet by a small DC motor. (older belt driven turntables have a belt that rides the motor spindle to a hub on the bottom of the platter, therefore transferring motor noise to the platter) The platter itself is a heavy acrylic that is solid as a rock. The tonearm is featherweight, tracks at 1 gram very nicely. I'm very happy with this turntable. It has made listening to my vinyl enjoyable again.
customer_reviews.author: Brownie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful turntable but has an annoying flaw.
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love most everything this turntable except for one thing. The sound reproduction is great, the minimalism is wonderful, the price point is outstanding, I hate the belt on the outside. I have found that most of the time despite my best intentions, when turning a record over or picking up a record, I pull the belt (rubber band) off the platter. It isn't the end of the world but very annoying that I have to put the belt on over and over again. Can't the engineers make a little channel on the platter where the belt can reside? It would still look the same but the belt would stay in place.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Deck
customer_reviews.text: Dust cover seemed cheap at first, but now I see that it's construction is useful to the overall sound- no metal hinges = no rattle/hum! .. Not sure how long the belt will last - seems to be too easily stretched although I've never had a deck with this type belt and haven't seen many complaints. Other than that - I'm not sure you could find it's equal for the price or even a few hundred more!... I'm sold on the U-turn Audio brand so far! Sound and construction are superb! Not sure I could be happier..
customer_reviews.author: Prime Rewards Card Member

customer_reviews.title: Design that Delivers
customer_reviews.text: I have to say that this is a fantastic turntable. This is my first turntable, so I was a little hesitant due to the price but after reading so many positive feedback on this one I decided to give it a shot. The sound quality is great. I must say that my favorite aspect about the product as a whole is the design of it. It's very clean, soft and the white and transparent material scheme it has is just lovely. It's sits beautifully in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: You can buy a 10 times better quality table at an audio shop for less money
customer_reviews.text: The belt falls off every time you kick the motor on the motor wobbles the solder joints on the bottom where the wires connect to it are exposed
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Love this turn table sounds great been a long time ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this turn table sounds great been a long time since I have owned one. Very easy to set up and works great. I actually was going to buy a different one but read the reviews like what I read. Not only is it a very nice entry level turn table it is made in the United States, this did have a little to do with why I decided to buy this one but am glad I did because it is a very nice turn table for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil Trucker

customer_reviews.title: Cheap deck with pricey needle
customer_reviews.text: Requires external preamp. Didn’t jive with SONOS amp. Would overheat...now this is probably the preamp or the SONOS connection, but it’s a pain to have to align 3 components. The dust cover doesn’t stay up on its own and there no auto lift for the time arm so you need to hold cover up while changing the record. Then lay the needle on and pick it up when side of LP is done. Very “hands on”. You are basically paying for the needle.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J. Arellano

customer_reviews.title: Top notch 👍 If you deciding just buy it 👌 The sound is great
customer_reviews.text: One thing I loved was the packaging above and beyond and if you don't know anything about Uturnaudio look them up USA made and it shows I was blown away on the quality you get a top-notch turntable ready to go out the box everything is dialed in. The packaging ensures your purchase is protected. The set up is a breeze but the only negative thing I have to say is the cue lever isn't included that's one thing I feel that should be included but overall this turntable is an outstanding piece thumbs up I highly recommend for all that are looking for a quality set up
customer_reviews.author: MstrJ3di

customer_reviews.title: Will compete with more expensive turn tables. Worthy of the cost!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is wow when it comes to this one. I was looking at a $600 dollar turn table before I purchased this. Sorry to the brick and mortar store that spun up a Jazz album on this same unit for me to say these speakers are what you want. In the process they sent me on the search for this turn table instead of a Project turn table. Buy this baby but make sure you understand this is an audiophile turn table yes belt is exposed no auto shut off not there. Sound reproduction is amazing and it out shines many others in this class.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Super simple and great sound quality. My only gripe is the round belt is way too easy to accidentally pull off. I think a flat belt would stay in place better, or better yet cut a thin groove in the acrylic platter. I added a a Q-up automatic tonearm raiser, which is outrageously overpriced for what it is but I would recommend. I immediately swapped the cartridge for an ortofon blue that I already had, but the stock cart sounded ok, if a little lifeless. Love the white color as it doesn't show dust and fingerprints as much!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great support from the company
customer_reviews.text: Great support from the company. Motor started making a ticking sound when first powered on. Emailed U-Turn and they immediately sent out a replacement as well as a link to how to replace it. No more ticking and stable as can be. Updated the cartridge to a Grado Blue and am most pleased with the setup.
customer_reviews.author: M. Penton

customer_reviews.title: $349 if ya want the lifter arm. Not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: The stupid belt comes off daily. If you need to move the turntable at all, ever... belt just falls off. Annoying! I had to also pay an extra $40 to get the arm lift kit so I can get my stylus off the record safely. Lame - include it and add $40 bucks to the price... you won’t sell many at $349 but at least it’s more honest.
customer_reviews.author: Redcape

customer_reviews.title: decent budget table. table has speed up and slow ...
customer_reviews.text: decent budget table. table has speed up and slow down problems after only two months of minimal use, however.
customer_reviews.author: c.o.

customer_reviews.title: Great Entry Level Turn Table
customer_reviews.text: I'm no expert on sound or anything like that. The sound is good. I have mine paired with UTurn's external preamp and it's still a little quiet coming out out my powered speakers as compared to a digital source from the same speakers. But... That doesn't mean it sounds bad. Also, set up was easy. I bought a tonearm lifter separately and that was easy. The turn table itself was a breeze to set up. I love this set up for two reasons, sound is good and the looks are top notch. I love it so much I'm getting another one.
customer_reviews.author: smallpsych

customer_reviews.title: Good but requires a separate Pre-Amp
customer_reviews.text: This turntable is the basics of basics. Good looking but nothing fancy.. You will need to buy a separate pre-amp unless you choose the Turntable with the right option. The head is all manual: you put it in yourself and when the side is finished you have to take it out yourself. Some may find that traditional, old-fashion, whatever. It's ok.
customer_reviews.author: Antony Passemard

customer_reviews.title: Minimalist triumph
customer_reviews.text: Great minimalist turntable. Two cons 1 too easy to lift tt belt with record which is not easy to replace since no groove or slot. Cue device gets in way while trying to replace belt. 2No lock for arm so it is easy to harm stylus while replacing belt. Operation is great. Cost is good for product quality
customer_reviews.author: Jacksprat

customer_reviews.title: DON'T NEED MORE THAN THIS, MADE IN USA, GREAT PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: HAS FEEL OF A MORE EXPENSIVE UNIT. I CUSTOMIZED MY OWN WITH A GRADO RED CARTRIDGE , ACRYLIC PLATTER,CUE ARM. AND BOUGHT A MANI SHIIT PRE AMP(BEST). I CAN'T SEE BUYING ANYTHING MORE EXPENSIVE. ORBIT BRINGS BACK THE FUN FOR LESS, AND ALL PRODUCTS LISTED ABOVE ARE MADE THE USA, FINALLY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: SO glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth, for months, on this one and a more expensive turn table. I had a sense to go with this one and I am so glad I did! Build quality is great and the sound output is fantastic! ESPECIALLY for the price point. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: Splinter76

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this turntable
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this turntable. I don't mind that it is completely manual. I don't think the cue lever is needed once you get used to placing the stylus. There is not auto-stop feature (record keeps spinning when side is complete), but that doesn't both me either since i'm actively listening to my records. The turntable is simple, well made, sounds great, and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Damon J. Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA and the best sounding out there!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! Never thought I would ever be able to buy a turntable MADE IN THE USA! And that the turntable would be not only beautiful but sounds amazing! It took less than 5 minutes to set up. The packaging was super. Thank you for making a great turntable!! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Darkwagoner

customer_reviews.title: Audio heaven! Beautiful, simple thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this little guy! It's simple, budget, and has a killer sound to it -- crisp, clean, full and alive. It's replacing a b&o Beogram rx (killer table, just had wiring issues). Paired with a marantz 2270 and Polk monitor 7s from the 70s, I'm in audio heaven!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Levy

customer_reviews.title: Belts suck on these
customer_reviews.text: Watch out the belts suck on these. most people can't handle putting the belts on without stretching them.
customer_reviews.author: shea henning

customer_reviews.title: ... turntable for a couple of months and is working great. No issues what so ever
customer_reviews.text: Had the turntable for a couple of months and is working great. No issues what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dillon

customer_reviews.title: Absolute steal for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Really beautiful design and great sound. I'm no audiophile (maybe an aspiring audiophile) but the overall quality is outstanding and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this to anyone. Great looking, made in America, and spectacular sound for the money. No brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Wahlstrom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: American made excellence and best product support ever when I bought another cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: itsme

customer_reviews.title: An awesome turntable
customer_reviews.text: A fantastic product from a fantastic company. Customer service is excellent and will respond quickly. It is easy to set up. Takes nearly no time.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Love this Turntable
customer_reviews.text: This is the most gorgeous turntable I have ever owned. And yes it sounds great too.
customer_reviews.author: C. C. Covelli

customer_reviews.title: Great turntable!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second u-turn turntable and I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ann St Germain

customer_reviews.title: Simple perfection
customer_reviews.text: The kind of performance and sound you'd expect from incredibly high-end equipment. I paired it with the Uturn phono amp and Edifier powered speakers and it all plays like $3000 worth of gear
customer_reviews.author: Dan Callender

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son (20) and it was super easy to set up and sounded great
customer_reviews.author: Larry Core

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound !
customer_reviews.text: A dream product to have ! I’m so hooked into listening to vinyl now !
customer_reviews.author: leo angelo t. medrano

customer_reviews.title: Great Green Vinyl Spinner
customer_reviews.text: Love this turntable. Does what it should. Constant speed warm sound. Very pleased one month in
customer_reviews.author: Spence

customer_reviews.title: Yes, but also no!
customer_reviews.text: I love the turntable and the sound. I am disappointed by the quality of the dust cover. The hinges are rubber or plastic so the cover doesn't always stay up on its own and the plastic cover has gouges in the upper corners. U-turn audio's production people said its part of the fabrication process. Sadly, no other product out there has this problem. A shame because the rest of the item is sleek and this takes away from the aesthetic.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Wortmann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love the simplicity of it and the sound is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: jesse simmons

customer_reviews.title: Awesome turntable for the money
customer_reviews.text: I really like the simplicity of it. It sounds great for a turntable in its price range. It came set up so I didn't have to make any adjustments before using it which was nice. It also looks really good!
customer_reviews.author: Rex B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Table
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough great things about this turntable. I've had it for a few months and it sounds and operates great. I listen to a lot of vinyl, and have to say that this table is a workhorse. My hat's off to the folks at U-Turn Audio for making such a wonderful table. I'm enjoying it immensely.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff T

customer_reviews.title: excellent sound
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased. Product was as described and The sound is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: nmf

customer_reviews.title: Seriously could not be happier! Great quality and sound for the amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Seriously could not be happier! Great quality and sound for the amazing price! I've put over 30 records through it already and haven't noticed any change in speed consistency. And made in America! You stay classy U Turn!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Glabus

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Clear sound with good bass
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Clear sound with good bass, and great design. Only problem I have with the Orbit is that (at least on mine) the dust cover does not completely cover the turntable while in use. I wish I could keep it on while the record is playing as I live in a fairly dusty environment. Nevertheless, a fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: After lots of research I decided on a U turn turntable I am not disappointed in any way with it, great to get back listening to vinyl again and if your looking for affordable quality I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Orbit Plus Turntable
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged and arrived on time. This turntable was easy to set up, it only took about 2 minutes. The audio quality is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Keefer

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this turntable
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this turntable. I was excited that it's made in the USA. The unit I received had issues with a hum and some distortion that I was unable to fully resolve even with the help of U-Turn tech support. In the end I made the decision to return the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: This is a great turntable. Although it's not fancy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great turntable. Although it's not fancy, it has all the basics to make vinyl sound great. Not only that U-Turn Audio has great support.
customer_reviews.author: R Allen Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an introduction to Hi-Fi Vinyl.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! U-Turn is by far one of the BEST choices for an introduction to Hi-Fi Vinyl playback. This is the plus model, which includes the acrylic platter. Personally I'd pick this over the Carbon Pro-Ject due to the fact that it's an all American company (design and production) and absolutely outstanding customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Dasweb

customer_reviews.title: Bring on the Vinyl...
customer_reviews.text: Never thought I would purchase a record player again. My boyfriend asked for this for Christmas and I'm so glad I bought it. He had been extremely happy with it. He had one record that he got for Christmas, but we now have over 50 (possibly more...Lol). This record player is very classy and fits right in with our house. We did have to get an adapter for it to work with our stereo system. I'm loving this purchase as much as he is!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Owens

customer_reviews.title: You can get it
customer_reviews.text: I'm absolutely in love. A sobering thought crept into my head... The reality that I now have the ability to play vinyls that have perhaps not spun in decades. It's beautiful and minimalist. With it, I feel as if I now have what Darth Sidious referred to as "unlimited power!" Worth the investment. Make sure, however, that if it's being plugged into a receiver that you have a PHONO input (you may forget that requirement due to excitement) or a converter that does just that. Then listen to some Supertramp.
customer_reviews.author: Marconius

customer_reviews.title: Defective cartridge......too bad
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pre-amp and the orbit at the same time. I made sure the records were clean but still had horrible distortion and bad sound. I didn't know if it was the preamp or turntable so had a repair shop in Chicago troubleshoot it and said it was a bad cartridge. They also recommended the Pro-Ject DCA Carbon. I'm sure not every orbit arrives defective but to me it was worth the extra $100 to buy from a local dealer and the Pro-Ject is an amazing product. Couldn't be happier with it. I wanted to like the Orbit as they're made in America but there's better stuff out there.
customer_reviews.author: T. Balzer

customer_reviews.title: I would love it if someone could help me out
customer_reviews.text: I can not find speakers for it. There is no sound and I am very frustrated. No instructions on what speakers to get. I would love it if someone could help me out.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Kennedy

product_meta.title: U-Turn Audio - Orbit Plus Turntable (White)
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteMeet the Orbit Plus Get more out of your records with the Orbit Plus. The acrylic platter doesnt just sit there looking pretty - it provides improved speed stability and dissipates unwanted resonances. The result: more life-like tonality and punchier bass. The Plus also features the Ortofon OM5E cartridge which is perfect for listeners who enjoy a wide variety of genres. Features Acrylic platter provides improved speed consistency and clearer more detailed playback. Ortofon OM5E cartridge with elliptical diamond stylus. Precision gimbal tonearm for accurate tracking and low distortion; features internal anti-skate and adjustable counterweight. External belt drive eliminates motor noise and ensures speed consistency (33/45 RPM). What's in the Box: Orbit Plus Turntable Felt mat Dust cover RCA cables AC adapter Specifications 33/45 RPM manual speed adjustment Weight: 12.5 lbs. Dimensions: 16.75" x 12.5" x 4.25" WF: 0.125% S/N ratio: -79dBA Rumble: - 63dBA Input voltage: 115V/60Hz
feature_bullets: Acrylic platter provides improved speed consistency and clearer more detailed playback.
Ortofon OM5E cartridge with elliptical diamond stylus.
Precision OA2 gimbal tonearm for accurate tracking and low distortion. Features internal anti-skate and adjustable counterweight.
External belt drive eliminates motor noise and ensures speed consistency (33/45 RPM).

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars146 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
